p: Humans have suffered from influenza for millennia, and we can expect that the new reality of COVID-19 will only complicate the next influenza season. Measures to reduce the overall burden of respiratory viral infection—including social distancing, increased vaccination rates, availability of diagnostics, and addressing health care disparities—are paramount in planning for the months ahead. Moreover, careful evaluation and modification of these factors will enhance preparedness ahead of viral pandemics yet to come.
